text: Question 13 @1\ Consider a three-level page table to translate a 39-bit virtual address to a physical address as shown below: <======-==----- 39-bit virtual address --------------=> | Level 1 | Level 2 | Level 3 | Page | | offset | offset | offset | offset | b ) 9 bits 9 bits 9 bits 12 bits The page size is 4 KB = (1KB =210 bytes) and page table entry size at every level is 8 bytes. A process P is currently using 2 GB (1 GB =230 bytes) virtual memory which os mapped to 2 GB of physical memory. The minimum amount of memory required for the page table of P across all levels is KB e 1024 X 4096 J 4108 @ 1864 GATE CSE 2021 SET-2 Memory Management
